messages.text: I have been sitting on this CL for a while now. I'm not happy with the escaping code but couldn't find anything else in the std library as a guide. strings.Replacer would be more convoluted in this case as I would have to pass 31 pairs characters to be escaped to NewReplacer().

Hello huin@google.com, agl@golang.org, gustav.paul@gmail.com (cc: cw@f00f.org, golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

Hello huin@google.com, agl@golang.org, gustav.paul@gmail.com (cc: cw@f00f.org, golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

Once a few of the other outstanding CLs I have waiting in my development trees are committed I'll address the comment you made on the tcpip.go CL wrt. sanitizing the returned messages from the server.

Sent from my iPad

>> mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

>> Please take another look.

> currently.
